\# Project Statement â€“ Simple Dictionary-Based Calculator

\#\# ![ğŸ“Œ][image2] Problem Statement

Basic arithmetic operations are commonly required in day-to-day tasks.  

This project aims to build a simple menu-driven calculator that can perform four core mathematical operations while demonstrating the use of Python functions, dictionary mappings, and input validation.

\---

\#\# ![ğŸ“˜][image3] Scope of the Project

\- Implement core arithmetic functions (add, subtract, multiply, divide)

\- Implement dictionary-based dynamic function calling

\- Handle invalid user inputs and division-by-zero errors

\- Provide a simple command-line interface for user interaction

\---

\#\# ![ğŸ¯][image4] Target Users

\- Students learning Python fundamentals  

\- Individuals needing a simple calculator utility  

\- Beginners exploring function mapping and basic program structure

\---

\#\# ![â­][image5] High-Level Features

\- Menu to select operations  

\- Modular function definitions  

\- Dictionary mapping for cleaner operation handling  

\- Error handling for invalid menu options and division by zero  

\- Simple and user-friendly interface
